episodes.title: The Cult That Dared God - The Untold Story of the Appalachian Snake Cult
episodes.description:
The Appalachian Mountains hold many secrets, one of the most interesting being the pentecostal snake cult that began rising in popularity at the turn of the 20th century, involving venomous snakes, blind belief, and a some of the most bizarre practices ever see within any sect of Christianity. 
In this episode of Zooaholics, we explore one of the most dangerous religious practices in American history: Pentecostal snake handling. Known by many as the rattlesnake cult, this bizarre and deadly tradition survives in remote mountain churches scattered across Tennessee, Kentucky, West Virginia, Alabama, and Georgia, where it claimed the lives of over 90 people, and has made up a large portion of America's snake related deaths. 

If you'd like to see more content like this, make sure to subscribe for more content on American naturalist history, biological phenomenon, and bizarre wildlife conspiracy.
